job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Lansing, MI
pros: I adore the community and the people I work with. I have two jobs and I cannot see myself leaving CMH any time soon.
cons: Sometimes working for a large organization is challenging, but I do not think this is a flaw of CMH, simply a con of working for a large agency.

job_title: MHT crisis services  in Lansing, MI
pros: Flex schedule Holidays or Holiday pay PTO
cons: Culture Stress Late hours Travel Communication

review_title: Not bad for what I was there for
job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Lansing, MI
pros: I worked at CMH while going to school, always intending to pursue employment in the field I was studying in. I was a relief worker, which meant I had a flexible schedule (as long as I cleared it with my manager first, but she was super accommodating). Pay was pretty good for the work I was doing.
cons: As a relief worker, I wasn't eligible for benefits. Benefits are based off your FTE, and relief workers are .475 FTE, no matter how many hours you actually work in a week. I didn't get overtime for working more than 19 hours per week, and even though I consistently worked over 20 hours, I wasn't eligible for the same PTO and benefits as other workers who were hired in at .5 FTE or greater. If I were planning on staying at CMH beyond the end of my school program, that could've been a challenge.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Lansing, MI
pros: Best supervisor I’ve had in years. Good benefits and reasonable expectations for workers.
cons: Not a huge fan of the current EHR.

job_title: Case Manager in Saginaw, MI
pros: Clear Training Guidelines & Union Based.
cons: Unmanageable Caseloads, Frequent Change in Supervision/Staffing

job_title: Family Service Worker (FSW) in Lansing, MI
pros: flexible schedule, good pay, great supervision
cons: the caseloads can be overwhelming at times

review_title: Great company to work for and great benefits
job_title: Recovery Coach in Lansing, MI
pros: Great Benefits, Tons of time off, decent pay, decent management
cons: could be better pay, not much room for advancement without a big degree

job_title: Coordinator in Lansing, MI
pros: Great benefits and pension, location, bonuses, raises, flexible schedules, upward movement, diversity of job opportunities, inclusion, trainings (free)
cons: Salary no longer is as competitive as it used to be, high caseloads, worker shortage, slow HR department, burnout, some areas lack diversity

job_title: Case Manager in Lansing, MI
pros: Mission, Educational Support, Benefits, Co- Workers, Sense of Community, Meaningful Work
cons:
Salary Ceiling
Management Can Be Obtuse
Paperwork Unreasonable
Uncertain Public Funding
Threat of Privatization

job_title: Client Service Specialist in Lansing, MI
pros: the supervisors were great and very helpful. Working with the clients can be stressful at times but over all rewarding.
cons: the job itself can cause burnout.

job_title: Supervisor in Lansing, MI
pros: CO-WORKERS were great to work with.
cons: Pay was low and could have been more.

review_title: New management and new rules are sinking this company
job_title: CSDD Home Manager in Lansing, MI
pros: In general, caring and understanding colleagues. Good, relatively inexpensive benefits.
cons: As middle management, very overworked for compensation. Little respect for personal time. Upper management in my department had no clue what they were doing.

job_title: Outpatient Therapist in Lansing, MI
pros: They pay great have great support and a great community together. The work can be overwhelming but you feel like you are really making a difference
cons: Case load is high but that's to be expected.

review_title: If you’re willing to risk your own mental & physical health.
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Lansing, MI
pros:
Pay and benefits are great and you can make more each year through a tiered salary system.
Plenty of opportunities for training.
Convenient parking and location.
You will meet people who really care about helping others.
cons:
Toxic work environment and HR will not help you.
Security officers may not have appropriate training and clients who are homeless often bring in weapons. You will meet many clinicians with personality disorders, bullying & intimidation behaviors. You will likely burnout fast unless you find a healthy manager (met just one healthy mgr in 3 years).

job_title: Cst in Lansing, MI
pros: They would try to work with your schedule
cons: Clinicians did not take your input seriously

job_title: Wraparound Facilitator in Lansing, MI
pros: Support, Management, great pay and benefits.
cons: Stressful and can get burnout fast depending on department your in

review_title: I have been proud to work for this organization
job_title: Clinical Mental Health Counselor in Lansing, MI
pros: I believe these individuals that work at CMH truly love their job and work hard to have a strong connection with clientele.
cons: I believe that CMH can be organizationally disorganized at times.

review_title: It all depends on the team you are on.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Britain, CT
pros: Attempts made at increasing morale through events throughout the year, no day is ever the same, good place to start your career, good place to learn
cons: Little career growth, high staff turnover, no raises or incentives except gift cards, they ask you to contribute to the company from your pay constantly when you don’t have enough to survive yourself on what you are paid, High staff turnover, inconsistency with directives from supervisory staff. Poor supervisors who have poor/little management skills.

job_title: Residential Technician in Lansing, MI
pros: I can't think of many other jobs available without a degree that pay this well. I always got along well with management and co-workers. I feel we made positive progress with the consumers, which is a good feeling.
cons: Sometimes just when you reach a sense of equilibrium, it all disappears because doctors want to switch up a med routine or a consumer who exhibits more problematic behaviors needs a placement. While everybody has good and bad aspects, some consumers are truly unpleasant to work with.

review_title: Awesome, supportive, and caring environment for client and staff!
job_title: Community Support for the Developmentally Disabled in Lansing, MI
pros: Great training, awesome and supportive work environment, direct contact with staff and management, variation of duties, amazing clients, and great pay!
cons: For the position I was in, we only were allowed 20 hours a week, which forced us to have second jobs. It takes about 1800 hours or approximately 21 months to obtain Special Part-Time status where you are eligible for more hours and health care benefits.

review_title: I have had a very positive experience with CMH.
job_title: Family Support Worker in Lansing, MI
pros: There is great management for FSWs that communicate well and provide a lot of support for employees.  You can pick up as many cases as you desire, so your schedule is very flexible and mostly up to you.
cons: The position is 0-19 hours per week, so while it is good that you can work as much or as little as you want, there is a limit.  Some of the kids you work with can be very difficult to manage, but that is expected with the position.

job_title: Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor in Lansing, MI
pros: Great place to work for benefits and PTO.  Very supportive upper-management and supervisory staff.  Lots of autonomy in order to do the job.
cons: To do a decent job for the number of consumers (with developmental disabilities) to be served, two or three more vocational counselors are needed to split up the caseloads.  Caseloads are too large - over 100 is common.

job_title: Residential Technician in Lansing, MI
pros: Union support, time off can build up quickly, wage step increase each year for first few years.
cons: Little communication between management and policy-setters and persons working inside the homes. Until a person can get a regular position, you have to start as relief and are not treated very well.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Lansing, MI
pros: Provides great flexibility, good benefits, competitive wages, focus on customer service and great company provided trainings.  The union is very helpful.
cons: Administrative communication can be poor at times.  Staff morale is often poor. Upward mobility options are limited.  Progress for change is slower than most places.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Lansing, MI
pros: Good pay and benefits. Opportunity to make a difference in an underserved population.
cons: Chronically understaffed, high work load and copious amounts of paperwork.

job_title: LMFT in Sacramento, CA
pros: Job security, no two days are ever the same
cons: Too much paperwork, low pay, student loan debt, supervisors are ruthless, you are expected to see 8 clients a day, no breaks in between. fellow employees are sickly due to stress. Long them effects of this career will impact your wellness negatively.

job_title: Family Support Worker in Lansing, MI
pros: One boss is awesome, the other is condescending and passive aggressive. Mileage Reimbursement, flexible schedule.
cons: Supervisor is rude and tells other coworkers info about your personal life and is overall incompetent to be doing the job.

job_title: Residential Technician in Eaton Rapids, MI
pros: Fulfilling to help people get back on track with their lives.
cons: Management of the AMHS program is extremely poor and is willing to do whatever it takes to save their own skins when they make mistakes.

review_title: a quite and good palace to work
